pr_title: Add missing contexts for resumeParsing, split resumeParsing Method and resolve parsing conflicts

timeline.message:
Add missing contexts for resumeParsing

Added missing contexts for resumePasing and added tests to verify those.

Fix ResumeParsing conflicts

Fix conflicts in resumeParsing where more than 1 method recovers with the same context.

timeline.bodyText:
parseCompoundAssignmentStmt() is only called within resumeParsing()
No other usage. Do we need that method?
timeline.author: lochana-chathura

replies.bodyText: I don't think we do. I ll remove it.
replies.author: m36dot

replies.bodyText:
when removing can remove those enclosing COMPOUND_ASSIGNMENT_STMT ctx as well. Seems it is referred in error handler also.
Same case with parseNilTypeDescriptor() and its NIL_TYPE_DESCRIPTOR ctx.
I think we may have to recheck the usage of those ctxs in error handler as well @SupunS WDYT?
replies.author: lochana-chathura

replies.bodyText: Yeah if the method doesn't go to error recovery (eg: parseNilTypeDescriptor method), then we don't need them in the resume method also
replies.author: SupunS

replies.bodyText:
@SupunS yea. In my second comment what I meant was , if we are removing those two methods we are eliminating
startContext(ParserRuleContext.COMPOUND_ASSIGNMENT_STMT); and startContext(ParserRuleContext.NIL_TYPE_DESCRIPTOR); calls from BallerinaParser.
But in the error handler still we are starting new ctxs for those ctxs. So I see some kind of inconsistency IINM.
May be we can create an issue to check on that and remove those unnecessary ctx starts from error handler?
replies.author: lochana-chathura

timeline.bodyText: parseNilTypeDescriptor() above this line also has no usage in other places.
timeline.author: lochana-chathura

replies.bodyText: yea, will remove that as well.
replies.author: m36dot

timeline.bodyText: we can check if this context is required in resumeParsing and remove // revisit comment
timeline.author: lochana-chathura

timeline.bodyText: if the conflict is resolved, we can remove the comment
timeline.author: lochana-chathura

replies.bodyText: forgot to remove the comment
replies.author: m36dot

timeline.message:
Refactor resumeParsing in ballerinaParser

Removed some outdated comments and removed some cases which werent necessary.

timeline.bodyText:
Can't we have the logic inside this function iteself?
There's no value addition of delegating the logic to another function, if this is the only place it is used..
timeline.author: SupunS

replies.bodyText: yea sounds good to me
replies.author: m36dot

timeline.bodyText: Shall we re-order the functions in the same order they are chained?
timeline.author: SupunS

replies.bodyText: sure
replies.author: m36dot

timeline.bodyText:
Since theres a separate method for resuming keywords, shall we move all keywords in to that method?
Fix in all places
timeline.author: SupunS
SupunS
SupunS

timeline.bodyText:
Whats the size of this method after refactoring?
Should we separate out syntax tokens (semicolons, commas, etc) as well?
timeline.author: SupunS

replies.bodyText: I think that ll be a good idea, resumeothernodes is about 300 lines long.
replies.author: m36dot

timeline.bodyText:
These mapping field related stuff are part of mapping constructor.Think these should go under resume expressions method ?
There are few other such cases.
timeline.author: SupunS

replies.bodyText: I ll look into it
replies.author: m36dot

replies.bodyText:
@m36dot There are still some more places that we can merge. eg: statements/module-level nodes related stuff that are added under "resumeOtherNodesParsing".
Is it possible to completely remove "resumeOtherNodesParsing" method?
replies.author: SupunS

replies.bodyText: I am not sure if we can entirely remove resumeothernodesparsing method. Where should types and binding patterns be moved to?
replies.author: m36dot

replies.bodyText: Can introduce a resume method for types?
replies.author: SupunS

timeline.bodyText: Don't we need this method? What if we reach here after recovering?
timeline.author: SupunS

replies.bodyText: no we don't. if we reach there all we have to do is just consume that token. Since we reach there we know for sure the token we want is the one we have.
replies.author: m36dot

replies.bodyText: What if we reach here by inserting a token as the recovery solution? Then consume() will pick the next token from the stream, not the inserted one..
replies.author: SupunS

replies.bodyText:
yes that is correct, but the method currently doesn't solve this issue. e.g if we get an asterisk token then we still just consume it.
shall I make the method take in next token instead of nextTokenKind, that way we can still use the recovered node.
replies.author: m36dot

replies.bodyText: also there is the point that the visibility qualifiers are optional hence recovery won't be inserting them.
replies.author: m36dot

timeline.message:
Fix parseTypedBindingPatternOrExprRhs

Fix how parseTypedBindingPatternOrExprRhs handles SyntaxKind.NONE
returned by recovery.

timeline.author: SupunS

replies.bodyText: forgot to remove it, will remove it
replies.author: m36dot

timeline.author: SupunS

replies.bodyText: will fix it
replies.author: m36dot

timeline.bodyText: Would "object member qualifier" be a better name?
timeline.author: SupunS

replies.bodyText: will change it
replies.author: m36dot

timeline.bodyText: Better to keep the override annotation
timeline.author: SupunS
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -136,220 +136,288 @@ public STNode parse(ParserRuleContext context) {
      * @param args Arguments that requires to continue parsing from the given parser context
      * @return Parsed node
      */
-    @Override

replies.bodyText: alright
replies.author: m36dot

timeline.bodyText: Can you explain why do we need to check SyntaxKind.NONE here?
timeline.author: SupunS

replies.bodyText: because recovery returns it when we try to parse source 2 from #24651
replies.author: m36dot

replies.bodyText: Why is it returning NONE? Shouldn't we fix that?
replies.author: SupunS

timeline.message:
Fix ErrorHandler returning SyntaxKind.NONE

Fix error handler returning SyntaxKind.NONE for recovery of
parseTypedBindingPatternOrExprRhs for source 2 in #24651
